===Etymology 2===
{{zh-forms|alt=塍,堘}}
The Min native word for “paddy field; field”.

Etymology unknown. The original word has been identified as {{och-l|塍|raised path between fields}}, although {{w|Jerry Norman (sinologist)|Norman}} proposes that this is related to {{och-l|層|layer}}, reflecting the terraced fields commonly found in Fujian ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}). Compare also {{och-l|㽪|wet field}}.

==Japanese==

===Kanji===
{{ja-kanji|grade=1|rs=田00}}

# [[paddy]], [[field]]

====Readings====
{{ja-readings
|goon=[[でん]] (den)
|kanon=[[てん]] (ten)
|kun=[[た]] (ta)
|nanori=[[だ]] (da)
}}

====Usage notes====
Note that the {{m|en|rice paddy}} meaning is specific to Japanese. The Chinese word for [[rice paddy]] is {{m|zh|水田}}.

====Compounds====
{{der-top|Compounds}}
* {{ja-r|豊田|とよた}}
* {{ja-r|成田|なりた}}
* {{ja-r|羽田|はねだ}}
* {{ja-r|半田|はんだ}}
* {{ja-r|油田|ゆでん}}: [[oil field]]
{{der-bottom}}

===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|た|yomi=k}}
From {{etyl|ojp|ja|sort=た}}. Appears in the [[w:Kojiki|''Kojiki'']] written in roughly 711-712.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|た|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR,NHK}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|た}}

# [[rice paddy]]
# [[cultivated]] [[field]]

====Usage notes====
The term ''ta'' can refer to either a wet field as for rice agriculture, or a dry field as for other crops. This term does not refer to a wild field or [[meadow]].

====Derived terms====
{{der-top}}
* {{ja-r|田圃|たんぼ}}, {{ja-r|田んぼ|たんぼ}}: a [[cultivated]] [[field]]
{{der-bottom}}
